comments.body: Do you have to assert this to `any`? Why doesn't `map` just get added to the prototype?
because type of prototype is `Observable<any>` and it does not have `map` property
But you're declaring an extension to `Observable<T>` below, so doesn't that mean `Observable<any>` should have a member named `map` of type `map<U>(proj: (e: any) => U): Observable<U>`?

this is just an example that in module `map` somebody can patch the prototype of `Observable` and add new functionality to it and _also_ describe what was done to our compiler via module augmentation. What was added to the prototype and how it was done is not really important here.

I think to some degree it is, since users who have not patched up the prototype prior to this will attempt to do this without asserting to `any`. If we can, let's amend this test to reflect the intended real world usage, or add another test.

our test suite is not a set of examples and I'd prefer not to pollute it with things that are non-relevant to feature being tested. Once we finalize the design and check-in the implementation we can add as many examples to the handbook as we want

I would help if conversations like these bore their fruits as extensive comments in the code.

If the members of the core team interpret that stuff differently, imagine the confusion of an external observer. Consider a day when both of you have left the team and no one knows `<any>` reason to have that cast in there.
